docs.snippet: The Wool Bureau is going to drop its "nice guy" posture and hit out at those new-fangled synthetics with some very competitive advertising.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Wool Bureau is going to drop its "nice guy" posture and hit out at those new-fangled synthetics with some very competitive advertising.
docs.abstract: Wool Bur plans ad drive stressing wool advantages over synthetics

headline.main: Advertising: Wool Is Coming Out Bristling

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Trudeau has acted wisely in introducing new legislation to deal specifically with the Quebec troubles and to cut back the sweeping powers assumed by the Canadian Government under the War Measures Act. He had promised a less drastic...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Trudeau has acted wisely in introducing new legislation to deal specifically with the Quebec troubles and to cut back the sweeping powers assumed by the Canadian Government under the War Measures Act. He had promised a less drastic emergency bill in any event and he was already getting considerable backlash from the inevitable discomforts and injustices for Canadians in keeping the country virtually on a war footing.
docs.abstract: ed lauds new legis on front terrorism; says strong-arm tactics are the only options pending internatl accord

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 8-- The flags of Cuba and Chile flew together here today at the unveiling of a statue of Ernesto Che Guevara. The ceremony was attended by revolutionary militants from all over Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 8-- The flags of Cuba and Chile flew together here today at the unveiling of a statue of Ernesto Che Guevara. The ceremony was attended by revolutionary militants from all over Latin America.
docs.abstract: E C Guevara statue unveiled in working-class dist of San Miguel before Latin-Amer revolutionary militants and dedicated by Socialist Mayor Palestro to Latin-Amer youth; illus; Cuba Workers Federation sec gen H Ramos attends rally; crowd sings natl anthems of Chile and Cuba

headline.main: Guevara Statue Unveiled In Workers' Area in Chile

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 9 (UPI) A Brazilian news magazine, Veja, today published what it said were interviews with Dr. Claude L. Fly and Aloysio Mares Dias Gomide, captives of Tupamaro guerrillas in Uruguay for more than three months.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 9 (UPI) A Brazilian news magazine, Veja, today published what it said were interviews with Dr. Claude L. Fly and Aloysio Mares Dias Gomide, captives of Tupamaro guerrillas in Uruguay for more than three months.
docs.abstract: Brazilian magazine Veja pub int reptdly with Fly and Gomides; buys rights for articles from Argentine magazine Panorama which reptdly found article and photographs in mailbox; Fly quoted as dissuading son J Fly from traveling to Uruguay as he said he would; Gomides reptdly is 'not bored'

headline.main: Magazine Reports Interview With Captives of Tupamaros

docs.snippet: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 10 Fort Marcy, with Jorge Velasquez riding, and Fiddle Isle, with Willie Shoemaker up, are the one, two choices in the $150,000 Washington D.C. International tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 10 Fort Marcy, with Jorge Velasquez riding, and Fiddle Isle, with Willie Shoemaker up, are the one, two choices in the $150,000 Washington D.C. International tomorrow.

headline.main: Fort Marcy Choice in D.C. International Today; FIELD OF 10 TO GO IN $150,000 EVENT Fiddle Isle, 2d U.S. Horse, Is Second Favorite in 19th Running of Laurel Race

byline.original: By JOE NICHOLS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 13 (UPI) Nine guerrillas robbed Uruguay's Bank of the Republic here early today. Preliminary estimates by bank officials valued the loot at $6million in jewels and cash.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 13 (UPI) Nine guerrillas robbed Uruguay's Bank of the Republic here early today. Preliminary estimates by bank officials valued the loot at $6million in jewels and cash.
docs.abstract: 9 Tupamaros rob Bank of Repub of about $6-million in jewels and cash after kidnapping 3 bank officials and using them as shields to get past guards; spend 3 1/2 hrs going through vaults; bank employe on duty at time may have been accomplice; leaves with group

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 13 (AP) David Graham and Bruce Devlin of Australia again mastered the World Cup course, Lee Trevino of the United States stomped off in anger and Roberto de Vicenzo kept the home crowd happy again today as the 72-hole golf...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 13 (AP) David Graham and Bruce Devlin of Australia again mastered the World Cup course, Lee Trevino of the United States stomped off in anger and Roberto de Vicenzo kept the home crowd happy again today as the 72-hole golf championship reached the halfway point.

headline.main: ARGENTINA NEXT AT HALFWAY MARK; U.S. Fourth, Far Back With a 283 De Vicenzo Keeps Individual Lead at 131

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 14 (UPI) -- David Graham and Bruce Devlin shot 65 and 66, respectively, for Australia today and virtually locked up the golden World Cup golf trophy with a fantastic 34-under-par 398 with one round to play. They led Argentina by 19...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 14 (UPI) -- David Graham and Bruce Devlin shot 65 and 66, respectively, for Australia today and virtually locked up the golden World Cup golf trophy with a fantastic 34-under-par 398 with one round to play. They led Argentina by 19 strokes.

headline.main: Australia Leads Cup Golf by 19 Strokes as Graham Gets 65 and Devlin 66; ARGENTINA IS NEXT IN TEAM TOURNEY Australia 34 Under Par on 398 After Graham Scores Birdies on Last 4 Holes

docs.abstract: police ask Interpol to help find thieves

headline.main: Uruguay Asks Interpol Aid In Hunt for Bank Robbers
